title: Bake It Like You Mean It (gnv64)
description:
Bake It Like You Mean It: Gorgeous Cakes from Inside Out 
by Gesine Bullock-Prado and Tina Rupp
Stewart, Tabori & Chang | March 2013 | ISBN-10 1617690139 | ePUB | 269 pages | 28.8 mb <a href="
http://www.amazon.com/Bake-It-Like-You-Mean/dp/1617690139" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.amazon.com/Bake-It-Like-You-Mean/dp/1617690139</a>

Gesine Bullock-Prado says itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s inside that really counts, and in this visually sumptuous book, the author of Sugar Baby and Pie it Forward showcases cakes that are beautiful from the inside out. Each chapter is devoted to a technique of making different types of cake, beginning with the easiest recipe and moving to the more technically difficult as the chapter progresses. When the cakes are cut, they will reveal intricate layers of patterns and designs, such as hearts, checkerboards, helixes, and colorful stripes, that will bring a smile to everyone who enjoys them. This compendium of gorgeous cake recipes and techniques will yield glorious meringues, sponge cakes, pound cakes, cheesecakes, and tarts for all levels of bakers. With her trademark wit and enthusiasm for the world of confections and baking, GesineÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s latest 

book will delight her fans.

About the Author <a href="
http://imageshack.us/a/img22/6830/ecg8.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://imageshack.us/a/img22/6830/ecg8.jpg</a>
Gesine Bullock-Prado is the creator of Gesine Confectionary, based in Vermont. She has been featured on the TODAY show, the Rachael Ray Show, and Food Network. Her new PBS cooking show, Life from Scratch, is set to air in spring 2013. She lives in Vermont.
Bullock-Prado was born in Washington, D.C. She is the daughter of a U.S. Army worker and a German opera singer. She attended the University of Virginia and Southwestern Law School, and became a licensed attorney in 1997.
Bullock-Prado co-founded the production company Fortis Films in 1995 with her sister Sandra Bullock and their father. As the company's lawyer and vice-president, Bullock-Prado co-produced the films Gun Shy and Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous and helped develop dozens of others, including Practical Magic and the series The George Lopez Show.
Bullock-Prado left the film industry in 2004 and relocated to Vermont. From 2005 to 2008, she owned a bakery in Montpelier; she is now an instructor at King Arthur Flour and a contributing food editor for Runner's World Magazine.
She is the author of four books, including the memoir My Life from Scratch: Confections of a Closet Master Baker (2009), and the cookbooks Sugar Baby (2011), Pie It Forward (2012), and Bake It Like You Mean It (2013).
Bullock-Prado's recipes have been featured on The Today Show, Fox and Friends, The Rachael Ray Show, Food Network, Better Homes and Gardens, Ladies Home Journal, In Style, Elle Decor, Shape Magazine and People Magazine.
She has been married to storyboard artist Raymond Prado since 1999
